MainCategory.Description: Technical Skills & Experience: Assesses the candidate's proficiency in required technologies (C#, .NET, SQL, etc.), database management, web technologies, and related tools, as well as their overall experience in software development and system configuration.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's resume, perform technical assessments (coding challenges, quizzes), and conduct thorough interviews focusing on past projects, technologies used, and problem-solving approaches. Verify experience with relevant technologies and assess the depth of their understanding.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with required technologies; lacks fundamental understanding.
Basic understanding of some required technologies; limited practical experience.
Proficient in some core technologies; demonstrates practical experience and ability to learn.
Strong proficiency in most required technologies; demonstrates solid practical experience and problem-solving skills.
Expert-level proficiency in all required technologies; extensive practical experience, deep understanding, and ability to innovate and lead.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving & Troubleshooting Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to identify, analyze, and resolve complex software and system issues effectively. Also includes coding quality, debugging, and bug fixing skills.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with hypothetical or real-world technical challenges and assess their approach to problem-solving. Analyze their code samples for quality, efficiency, and maintainability. Ask about their experience with debugging tools and techniques.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Unable to effectively identify and analyze problems; struggles to find solutions.
Limited problem-solving skills; requires significant guidance to resolve issues.
Demonstrates basic problem-solving skills; able to resolve simple issues independently.
Strong problem-solving skills; able to independently identify, analyze, and resolve complex issues.
Exceptional problem-solving skills; able to quickly and effectively resolve even the most complex issues; proactive in identifying potential problems.

MainCategory.Description: Communication & Interpersonal Skills: Assesses the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, collaborate with team members, and provide excellent customer service. Includes team collaboration and stakeholders' management skills.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's communication skills through interviews, presentations, and writing samples. Evaluate their ability to work effectively in a team environment through behavioral questions and reference checks.  Observe their interaction with the interview panel.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills; unable to effectively convey information or collaborate with others.
Limited communication skills; struggles to articulate ideas and work effectively in a team.
Demonstrates adequate communication skills; able to convey information and collaborate effectively in a team.
Strong communication skills; able to effectively convey information, collaborate with others, and build rapport with stakeholders.
Exceptional communication skills; able to communicate complex information clearly and concisely, build strong relationships with stakeholders, and effectively lead and motivate teams.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) & Agile Methodologies: Assesses the candidate's understanding of the software development lifecycle and their experience with agile methodologies.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience with different SDLC models and agile frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban). Evaluate their understanding of key concepts such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no understanding of SDLC or agile methodologies.
Basic understanding of SDLC and/or agile methodologies; limited practical experience.
Familiar with SDLC and agile methodologies; some practical experience.
Strong understanding of SDLC and agile methodologies; significant practical experience.
Expert-level understanding of SDLC and agile methodologies; extensive practical experience and ability to implement and optimize agile processes.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality & Maintainability: Assesses the quality of the code written by the candidate, focusing on readability, efficiency, and maintainability.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples provided by the candidate, paying attention to coding style, use of comments, and overall structure. Look for evidence of adherence to coding standards and best practices.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is difficult to read and understand; lacks comments and proper structure; prone to errors.
Code is somewhat readable but could be improved; some comments are present; structure is adequate.
Code is well-written, easy to read, and maintainable; includes clear comments and follows coding standards.

SubCategory.Description: Testing & Debugging: Evaluates the candidate's ability to write and execute unit tests, identify and fix bugs, and ensure the overall quality of the software.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience with testing frameworks and debugging tools. Assess their ability to write effective unit tests and troubleshoot complex issues.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with testing and debugging; struggles to write unit tests and identify bugs.
Basic understanding of testing and debugging concepts; able to write simple unit tests and identify some bugs.
Proficient in testing and debugging; able to write effective unit tests, identify and fix bugs, and ensure the overall quality of the software.

SubCategory.Description: Requirements Analysis & Design: Assesses the candidate's ability to understand and analyze user requirements, and to design effective software solutions that meet those requirements.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with a set of user requirements and ask them to design a software solution that meets those requirements. Evaluate their ability to identify key requirements, consider different design options, and document their design decisions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to understand user requirements and design effective software solutions.
Able to understand basic user requirements and design simple software solutions.
Proficient in requirements analysis and design; able to understand complex user requirements and design effective software solutions that meet those requirements.

SubCategory.Description: Adaptability & Learning Agility: Assesses the candidate's ability to adapt to new technologies, learn quickly, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience with learning new technologies and adapting to changing priorities. Evaluate their willingness to learn and their ability to quickly grasp new concepts.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to change; struggles to learn new technologies and adapt to new situations.
Willing to learn but may require significant guidance and support.
Adaptable and eager to learn; quickly grasps new concepts and thrives in a fast-paced environment.
